path: books/Category Theory For Programmers/15. The Yoneda Lemma/3

attr.q: A list of units `[()]` contains no other information but its length. So, as a data type, it can be considered an encoding of integers. An empty list encodes zero, a singleton `[()]` (a value, not a type) encodes one, and so on. Construct another representation of this data type using the Yoneda lemma for the list functor.
attr.a: If you give `()` as a to Yoneda lemma for the list functor, you get set of natural transformations from `C((), -)` to List that are isomorphic to `[()]`. So the data type of the natural transformations `(()->x)->[x]` could be another representation.
